oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Video - 1929 Memphis and other scenes
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: buildings; businesses; churches; cotton; Cotton Carnival; Mississippi River; Overton Park; schools; transportation; 1920s; 1930s; 1940s;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A compilation of film clips, beginning around 1929. Includes footage from 1932 Cotton Carnival and an early WMC-TV broadcast (pre-1952).

1929 Film Log
00:05 – Mississippi River, Frisco and Harahan Bridges, Riverboats 01:08 – Shelby County Courthouse 01:27 – Baptism in river 01:38 – Tennis courts at Beauregard Park 02:20 – Hodges Field 02:45 – Trees (Bridges in distance) 02:54 – Goats 03:25 – Lumberyards 04:23 – Memphis Steam Laundry 04:36 – Downtown buildings and skyline 05:04 – Downtown from river 05:16 – Traffic from above 05:40 – Dredge barge and speedboats 06:14 – Downtown from river 06:34 – Speedboats 07:06 – Idlewild Presbyterian Church 07:58 – Automobile 08:10 – Shelby County Building at Fairgrounds 08:21 – DeSoto Park 09:04 – Nathan Bedford Forrest Park 09:39 – Unknown downtown church with passing streetcar 10:15 – Train Station (Memphis & Charleston Train Depot ?) 10:39 – Men golfing in Overton Park, Rainbow Lake 11:15 – Court Square 12:00 – Mississippi River and bridges from high 12:17 – Shelby County Courthouse from above 12:37 – Confederate Park 12:46 – Trees and riverbank 12:51 – Downtown church from above (St. Peter’s Catholic Church) 12:57 – North Second Street from above (M.L. Guion Co.) 13:23 – Beth El Emeth 13:49 – Memphis Tech High 13:59 – Car on street 14:13 – Rhodes College 14:50 – Overton Park clubhouse 15:33 – Brooks Museum 15:55 – Public Wading Pool at Park (Overton?) 16:24 – Municipal Pool at Fairgrounds – “All Out When Bell Rings” 17:09 – River 17:38 – Unknown Building with American flag 17:44 – Shrine Building 17:54 – Lincoln American Tower 18:00 – Sterick Building under construction 18:11 – Downtown Skyline 19:26 – Trees 19:34 – Memphis Compress & Storage 19:43 - Unknown company (International Harvester?) 19:57 - Unknown warehouse with American flag 20:11 - Unknown plant with smokestack 20:24 - Unknown company 20:36 - Humko Lard Company 20:48 - Buckeye Cotton Oil Co. (Hollywood Plant) 21:26 - U.S. Customs House 21:44 - Steamboat & barge 22:02 - Riverfront conveyor/elevator with cotton 22:24 - Riverboat traveling under bridge 22:33 - Riverfront conveyor/elevator with cotton 22:54 - Riverfront from South Bluffs 23:10 - Train crossing Harahan Bridge 24:01 - Southern Cotton Oil Co. 24:29 - Unknown (School?) 24:37 - Unknown (School?) 24:45 - Unknown Park (probably Overton) 24:55 - Creek, bayou or stream 25:17 - Road (possibly in Overton Park) 25:35 - Agfa logo 25:39 - Cotton bales and columns 25:43 - Cotton Carnival - Re-enactment of Washington crossing the Delaware (1932 Cotton Carnival) - May 11, 1932 26:22 - Cotton Carnival - Arrival of King (J.P. Norfleet) and Queen (Catherine Butler) by boat - May 11, 1932 26:57 - Cotton Carnival - Young men board boat and throw boxes overboard (Boston Tea Party Reenactment?) 27:27 - Cotton Carnival - The King and Queen disembark. 28:05 - Cotton Carnival - The King and Queen greet the crowd 28:15 - Cotton Carnival - Parade 28:23 - Cotton Carnival - The King and Queen are presented the keys to the city by the mayor, Watkins Overton 29:28 - Cotton Carnival - The parade continues 30:10 - Social gathering outside a residence (mostly women) 33:33 - Siena College sign 33:45 - Toddler and others outside 34:45 - Children’s play 35:39 - Television broadcast (church service) 36:13 - WMCT logo 36:19 - Television broadcast (scenic images - some aerial - probably not local) 36:53 - Video editing tricks with dates 39:26 - Cotton gin 39:53 - Cotton vacuum 40:29 - Weighing cotton in the field 40:57 - Picking cotton 42:28 - Cotton bales ready for transport 42:52 - Truck with cotton load 43:19 - Workers and cotton in the street 43:38 - Loading cotton on barge 44:05 - Moving bale on riverfront 44:24 - Loading cotton on barge 44:46 - Waiting to load cotton 45:00 - Barge with cotton 45:09 - Snowden Elementary (?) 45:27 - Lumberyard 46:14 - Nickey Brothers, Inc. 46:25 - Barrel making (with fire!) 46:50 - Lumber mill 47:40 - Canoeing down a flooded river [50:21 - Unknown bridge] 51:39 - Sky and airplanes 52:11 - Snow in Overton Park (Brooks, Dough Boy, Japanese Garden) 54:58 - Unknown three-story building 55:16 - Unknown church 55:33 - Unknown three-story building [see 54:58] 55:50 - Confederate Park 56:20 - Frisco and Harahan bridges 56:49 - Cotton conveyor/transit/barge 57:21 - Mississippi River and riverfront 57:45 - Frisco and Harahan bridges [see 56:20] 58:10 - Cotton conveyor/transit/barge [see 56:49] 58:28 - Mississippi River and riverfront [see 57:21] 58:49 - lumberyards 59:15 - Union and 2nd 59:43 - Farnsworth Building (MBJ) 59:49 - Union and 2nd 59:59 - streetlight 1:00:11 - sidewalk 1:00:19 - streetcars and cars at intersection (Bill’s 168-170 Union) 1:00:54 - The Radio Co. (199 Union) 1:01:15 - sidewalk from above 1:01:30 - Unknown building with porte cochere (gas station?) 1:01:54 - Airport 1:02:32 - large rail yard 1:02:53 - Illinois Central Railroad sign 1:02:58 - rail yard 1:03:18 - clouds in sky 1:03:37 - children by duck pond 1:03:52 - Dough Boy statue 1:04:06 - intersection of Union and ...Main? (Palace Hotel at 80 Union) 1:04:36 - toy boats at the lake/pond 1:06:10 - train
